Package net.minecraft.network

Class CompressionDecoder

java.lang.Object
net.minecraft.network.CompressionDecoder
public class CompressionDecoder  extends Object
Utility class for decompressing and decoding a ByteBuf.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final int
    MAXIMUM_COMPRESSED_LENGTH
    The maximum size of a compressed byte buffer, in bytes.
    static final int
    MAXIMUM_UNCOMPRESSED_LENGTH
    The maximum size of an uncompressed byte buffer, in bytes.
    private final Inflater
    inflater
    The inflater that is used to inflate a compressed buffer.
    private int
    threshold
    The maximum amount of bytes that can be read before the inflater must be used during decoding.
    private boolean
    validateDecompressed
    Whether decompressed buffers should be validated.

  • Constructor Detail

    • CompressionDecoder

      public CompressionDecoder(int threshold, boolean validateDecompressed)
      Constructs a new CompressionDecoder.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The maximum amount of bytes that can be read before the inflater must be used during decoding.
      validateDecompressed - Whether decompressed buffers should be validated.

  • Method Details

    • decode

      protected void decode(ChannelHandlerContext context, ByteBuf encoded, List<object> list)
      Decodes and decompresses a ByteBuf into another ByteBuf.
      Parameters:
      context - The handler context to use.
      encoded - The Byte Buffer to encode.
      list - The list to write the decoded object to.

    • setupInflaterInput

      private void setupInflaterInput(ByteBuf buffer)
      Sets up the inflater's data with the given buffer.
      Parameters:
      buffer - The buffer to use for the inflater.

    • inflate

      private ByteBuf inflate(ChannelHandlerContext context, int initialCapacity)
      Inflates a byte buffer.
      Parameters:
      context - The handler context to use.
      initialCapacity - The initial capacity of the Byte Buffer.
      Returns:
      The inflated Byte Buffer.
      Throws:
      DataFormatException - if the size of the read buffer does not match the inputted initial capacity

    • setThreshold

      public void setThreshold(int threshold, boolean validateDecompressed)
      Sets the threshold and whether decompressed packets should be validated.
      Parameters:
      threshold - The maximum amount of bytes that can be read before the inflater must be used during decoding.
      validateDecompressed - Whether decompressed buffers should be validated.
